events.originalText: Netflix released Black Mirror: Bandersnatch, its first interactive content for adults.
events.subtitle: Netflix
events.headline: Netflix releases Black Mirror: Bandersnatch, first interactive content for adults

events.originalText: The passenger ferry Norman Atlantic (pictured) caught fire in the Adriatic Sea.
events.subtitle: MS Norman Atlantic
events.headline: Norman Atlantic passenger ferry catches fire in Adriatic Sea

events.originalText: Kurdish–Turkish conflict: Acting on information that Kurdish militants were crossing the border from Iraqi territory, two Turkish F-16 jets fired at a group of villagers, killing 34 people.
events.subtitle: Kurdistan Workers' Party insurgency
events.headline: Turkish F-16 jets kill 34 villagers in Kurdish–Turkish conflict

events.originalText: A suicide bomber attacked a Shia procession commemorating the day of Ashura in Karachi, Pakistan, causing 43 deaths.
events.subtitle: 2009 Karachi bombing
events.headline: Suicide bomber kills 43 in Shia procession in Karachi, Pakistan

events.originalText: Tibetan dissident filmmaker Dhondup Wangchen was imprisoned for subversion by Chinese authorities after a secret trial.
events.subtitle: Dhondup Wangchen
events.headline: Chinese authorities imprison Tibetan filmmaker Dhondup Wangchen

events.originalText: Somali Civil War: Troops of Somalia's Transitional Federal Government and their Ethiopian allies captured Mogadishu unopposed.
events.subtitle: War in Somalia (2006–2009)
events.headline: Somali troops capture Mogadishu unopposed in Civil War

events.originalText: In one of Australia's worst natural disasters, an earthquake measuring 5.6 ML struck Newcastle, New South Wales, killing 13 people and injuring more than 160 others, and causing an estimated A$4 billion in damages.
events.subtitle: 1989 Newcastle earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake in Newcastle, Australia kills 13 and causes $4 billion in damages

events.originalText: American businesswoman Muriel Siebert became the first woman to own a seat on the New York Stock Exchange.
events.subtitle: Muriel Siebert
events.headline: Muriel Siebert first woman to own seat on NY Stock Exchange

events.originalText: World War II: After eight days of brutal house-to-house fighting, the 1st Canadian Infantry Division captured the Italian town of Ortona (depicted).
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: 1st Canadian Infantry Division captures Ortona in World War II

events.originalText: At the Irish general election, Constance Markievicz was elected to the House of Commons of the United Kingdom as the first female member of Parliament, although she never took her seat.
events.subtitle: 1918 Irish general election
events.headline: Constance Markievicz elected first female member of UK Parliament

events.originalText: An earthquake registering 7.1 Mw struck near Messina, which, along with the subsequent tsunami, killed at least 75,000 people in southern Italy.
events.subtitle: 1908 Messina earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake and tsunami in Messina, Italy kills at least 75,000

events.originalText: The last confirmed sighting of the now-extinct huia occurred in the Tararua Range on New Zealand's North Island.
events.subtitle: Huia
events.headline: Last confirmed sighting of huia in Tararua Range, New Zealand

events.originalText: The Tay Bridge, spanning the Firth of Tay in Scotland between Dundee and Wormit, collapsed during a violent storm while a train was passing over it, killing all on board.
events.subtitle: Tay Bridge
events.headline: Tay Bridge collapses in Scotland, killing all on board

events.originalText: American Civil War: Union forces defeated a Confederate cavalry unit at the Battle of Van Buren, capturing three steamboats, Confederate troops, and various supplies.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Union forces defeat Confederates at Battle of Van Buren

events.originalText: Taksin the Great was crowned king of the newly established Thonburi Kingdom at the new capital of Thonburi in present-day Thailand.
events.subtitle: Taksin
events.headline: Taksin the Great crowned king of Thonburi Kingdom in Thailand

events.originalText: Galileo Galilei became the first person to observe the planet Neptune, although he mistakenly catalogued it as a fixed star.
events.subtitle: Galileo Galilei
events.headline: Galileo Galilei observes Neptune for the first time

events.originalText: Westminster Abbey, built by Edward the Confessor as the first Romanesque church in England, was first consecrated.
events.subtitle: Westminster Abbey
events.headline: Westminster Abbey consecrated as first Romanesque church in England

events.originalText: An earthquake destroyed the city of Dvin, Armenia, resulting in about 30,000 casualties.
events.subtitle: 893 Dvin earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake destroys Dvin, Armenia with about 30,000 casualties

events.originalText: Alaric II succeeded his father Euric as King of the Visigoths.
events.subtitle: Alaric II
events.headline: Alaric II becomes King of the Visigoths, succeeding Euric
